alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Florence, north central Georgetown, southwestern Horry, south central Marion and northeastern Williamsburg Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hemingway, or 19 miles west of Conway, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conway, Red Hill, Horry, Johnsonville, Hemingway, Hickory Grove, Homewood, Horry Georgetown Technical College Conway Campus, Adrian, Pee Dee Crossroads, Poston, Brittons Neck, Dongola, Outland, Coastal Carolina University, Aynor, Lighthouse Care Center Of Conway and Conway Medical Center. This includes SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northeastern South Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Central Horry; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg
